byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU

abstract: Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan's Justice and Development Party regains majority in Parliament after executing remarkable electoral comeback in which it won 316 seats; most polls had predicted Islamist party, known as AKP, would not achieve majority; critics say victory was won by Erdogan employing divisive rhetoric and denigrating his opponents as well as government crackdown on dissent just before election.
lead_paragraph: The results of a snap election represent a stunning electoral comeback, and ensure another period of single-party government in Turkey.

headline.main: Erdogan’s Party in Turkey Regains Parliamentary Majority
headline.print_headline: Islamist Party Gains Majority in Turkish Vote

snippet: The results of a snap election represent a stunning electoral comeback, and ensure another period of single-party government in Turkey.
